metadata.title: CVE-2015-8396 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the ImageRegionReader::ReadIntoBuffer function inMediaStorageAndFileFormat/gdcmImageRegionReader.cxx in Grassroots DICOM(aka GDCM) before 2.6.2 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code viacrafted header dimensions in a DICOM image file, which triggers a bufferoverflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8396` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgdcm-cil - 2.6.2-2
libgdcm-tools - 2.6.2-2
libgdcm2.6 - 2.6.2-2
libvtkgdcm-cil - 2.6.2-2
libvtkgdcm-tools - 2.6.2-2
libvtkgdcm2.6 - 2.6.2-2
php5-gdcm - 2.6.2-2
php5-vtkgdcm - 2.6.2-2
python-gdcm - 2.6.2-2
python-vtkgdcm - 2.6.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdcm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.2-2').
